basics.name: Vamshi Basupalli
basics.summary:
I am a Software Engineer. In my career spanning 15 years, I have worked on Web Services, Systems Programming, Software Security, High Performance Computing and Embedded Systems.
Currently, I build backend services using Python asyncio, Go, Kubernetes, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, RabbitMQ, Docker and Bash.
basics.label: Computer Software

work.summary: Building Multi Cloud Management Platform (MCMP), an IBM enterprise product. Technical lead and senior backend developer for actions, health and multi-tenancy parts of the product

Technical lead and one of the main back-end developers for Software Assurance Marketplace (SWAMP). For SWAMP, I automated the application of software assessment tools for languages such as Java, .NET, Python, Ruby, PHP and JavaScript

work.company: Pacific Northwest National Laboratory, Richland, Washington
work.summary: Developed HPC framework to scale simulation/modeling software systems. Evaluated/studied Bio-inspired solutions for problems in Smart Grids
Optimized and vectorized image processing algorithms for a client developing computer-chip-wafer inspection machines

work.company: Colorado State University, Fort Collins, Colorado
work.summary: Analyzed North American Animal Disease Spread Model (NAADSM) for performance bottlenecks and provided solutions to remove them

Worked on the development of a portable scanner for vehicle on-board diagnostics and an in-vehicle network sniffer application. Developed a Palm OS based application for a sales team of a consumer electronics company

education.institution: Colorado State University, Fort Collins, Colorado
Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Hyderabad, Telangana

projects.title: Drive Weather Forecast
projects.description:
I am paranoid about driving in the snow on road trips; several years ago I built this application for myself to get the weather conditions through out the way. 
In the spring of 2020, I had a chance to put it on the internet for family and friends to use.
Technologies used here are Python asyncio, websockets and Kubernetes

projects.title: Bingo Cards
projects.description:
During the Covid-19 lock-down times, my wife wanted to play Bingo with her parents and neighbors but did not have the bingo tickets. 
The application generates a Bingo ticket. Users can click and mark the numbers on the tickets.
